themes: Shift from DEI focus to artistic merit
Support for underrepresented artists in application process
Grant program structure and genre expertise
key_phrases: focus on performance, music, bringing arts of all genre's to the community
prior emphasis on diversity, equity and inclusion, rather than the art
underrepresented artists do not always have the ability to prepare grant applications
Cultural Arts Division staff who hold office hours and are happy to help
interviewers must be familiar with the organization's performance repertoire
three levels of grant applications (Nexus, Thrive and Elevate) are acceptable
further breakdown within those levels to insure that the applications are evaluated by knowledgeable reviewers within the genre
barriers_identified: underrepresented artists do not always have the ability to prepare grant applications
interviewers making assumptions about the organization/performer
lack of genre-specific knowledge among reviewers
solutions_proposed: focus on performance and artistic merit rather than solely on DEI
maintain staff support (office hours) for application preparation
require interviewers to be familiar with the organization's repertoire and application
ensure unbiased interviews based on knowledge of organization and content
further breakdown of grant levels for genre-specific evaluation by knowledgeable reviewers
